void cbDraw (  void   ) 
 

OpenGL Draw Callback. This routine does the actual drawing.

void cbKeyPressed (  unsigned char  key,
int  x,
int  y
) 
 

Process a user Key Press. OpenGL calls this back when the user presses a normal key on the keyboard. The Window must have focus.

void cbReshape (  int  Width,
int  Height
) 
 

Callback routine to recompute the window size if it gets re-sized by the user. Called by OpenGL. Returns to OpenGL.

Referenced by setupDrawing().

void cbSpecialKeyPressed (  int  key,
int  x,
int  y
) 
 

Process a user Function Key Press. OpenGL calls this back when the user presses function and arrow keys on the keyboard (non-ASCII). The Window must have focus.

void cleanUpAndExit (  void   ) 
 

This cleans-up all instantiated objects, closes GL and eventually exits the program. It's everything that would normally be done at the end of main() but it needs to be called explicitly from an OpenGL callback once its detected that the user wants to exit.

int main (  int  argc,
char **  argv
) 
 

Main Entry Point. Creates the OpenGL window, opens the DMA driver, starts reads from the ColorBar IP module and displays the pixel data in the OpenGL window.
